extracted_playbook.title: Update ThinManager to v13.1.3 or later
extracted_playbook.description: Update ThinManager v13.1.X to version 13.1.3 or later to mitigate the vulnerability.

extracted_playbook.title: Update ThinManager to v13.2.2 or later
extracted_playbook.description: Update ThinManager v13.2.X to version 13.2.2 or later to mitigate the vulnerability.

extracted_playbook.title: Apply Security Best Practices
extracted_playbook.description: Apply security best practices if unable to upgrade ThinManager to a corrected version.

extracted_playbook.title: Minimize Network Exposure
extracted_playbook.description: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.

extracted_playbook.title: Locate Control Systems Behind Firewalls
extracted_playbook.description: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from business networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Secure Remote Access Methods
extracted_playbook.description: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), and ensure they are updated to the most current version available.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Impact Analysis and Risk Assessment
extracted_playbook.description: Perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Cybersecurity Strategies for ICS
extracted_playbook.description: Implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets, as detailed in CISA's guidance.

extracted_playbook.title: Protect Against Social Engineering Attacks
extracted_playbook.description: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages. Refer to CISA's guidance on recognizing and avoiding email scams and social engineering attacks.

extracted_playbook.title: Report Suspected Malicious Activity
extracted_playbook.description: Follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
